versions.name: Initial version
versions.media: Nintendo DS Game Card, Game Boy Advance Cartridge

versions.name: Nintendo DSi XL
versions.summary:
The extra large version of the Nintendo DSi. 
The system itself is larger overall than the other Nintendo DS versions. 
The screens are larger than the Nintendo DSi, at 4.2-inch (110 mm), and have a larger viewing angle than the other versions allowing people around the main user to easily view the game being played. 
The system came with an extra stylus that did not fit into the system and was made in the style of a pen.
versions.cpu: ARM9 clocked at 133 MHz and ARM7 clocked at 33 MHz
versions.storage: 256 MB internal flash memory, SD card (up to 2gb), SDHC card (up to 32gb)
versions.online: Nintendo Wi-Fi Connection, Nintendo DSi Shop, Nintendo Zone
versions.media: Nintendo DS Cartridge, Nintendo DSi Cartridge

versions.name: Nintendo DS Lite
versions.summary:
A lighter and slimmer version of the Nintendo DS. 
It has improved brightness with 4 settings for the screen backlight. 
The battery can last twice as long as the Nintendo DS on the lowest setting and lasts about 1-2 hours less on the highest setting, depending on the game being played.
versions.sound: Stereo speakers providing virtual surround sound, depending on the software.
versions.media: Nintendo DS Game Card, Game Boy Advance Cartridge
versions.output: Terminals for stereo headphones and a microphone.

versions.name: Nintendo DSi
versions.summary:
An improved version of the Nintendo DS. 
It does not have a Game Boy Advance Cartridge slot. 
It has more RAM and a faster CPU than the Nintendo DS and Lite versions. 
It has slightly larger screens and 5 brightness settings. 
It has 2 digital cameras.
versions.cpu: ARM9 clocked at 133 MHz and ARM7 clocked at 33 MHz
versions.storage: 256 MB of internal flash memory, slots for a SD card (up to 2 GB) and a SDHC card (up to 32 GB)
versions.online: Nintendo Wi-Fi Connection, Nintendo DSi Shop, Nintendo Zone
versions.media: Nintendo DS Game Card, Nintendo DSi Game Card
